item.title: Thread on contextual bandits, medicine, and web advertising
item.description:
Alexandros Marinos (is in Crete) on Twitter

‚ÄúNowhere in nature do we see an equivalent to the billion-dollar RCT. Facebook engineer Jeff Hammerbacher is famously quoted for having said: ‚ÄúThe best minds of my generation are thinking about how to make people click ads‚Äù. Maybe they weren‚Äôt totally wasting their time after all?‚Äù

item.title: We're getting an Omicron-optimized booster many months too late
item.description:
The FDA is calling for booster shots to be reformulated this fall to specifically target the Omicron variant of the SARS-CoV-2 virus. The mRNA technology behind the shots is supposed to make it fairly easy to tweak vaccines to target new variants. And the virus has evolved so rapidly that an update seems obviously warranted ‚Ä¶

URL: https://www.slowboring.com/p/were-getting-an-omicron-optimized?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: The Right
item.description:
Listen now (35 min) | For all of the mainstream media‚Äôs coverage of Donald Trump, there‚Äôs not a very deep understanding of the Republican Party under that president, or, indeed, the forces that led up to his election. In the liberal press, there just has not been that much curiosity about the nuances of the American conservative movement ‚Äî and the historical and political fo‚Ä¶
